metadata.Title: CVE-2023-45871 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/net/ethernet/intel/igb/igb_main.c in theIGB driver in the Linux kernel before 6.5.3. A buffer size may not beadequate for frames larger than the MTU.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-45871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-37-generic - 6.2.0-37.38
linux-image-6.2.0-37-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-37.38
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-37-generic - 6.2.0-37.38
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-37-generic-64k - 6.2.0-37.38
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-kvm - 6.2.0-1017.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-aws - 6.2.0-1016.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-azure - 6.2.0-1017.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1019-gcp - 6.2.0-1019.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1017.17
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1017.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-oracle - 6.2.0-1016.17
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1017-raspi - 6.2.0-1017.19
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1009-starfive - 6.2.0-1009.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-37.38').
linux-kvm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1017.17').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1016.16').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1017.17').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1019.21').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1017.17').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1016.17').
linux-raspi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1017.19').
linux-starfive package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1009.10').
